items.title: Amplitude-Phase Factorization
items.content:
181: :label: prop-cg-color-amplitude-phase
182: 
183: Each color phase $\varphi_i^a$ can be written in amplitude-phase form:
184: 
185: $$
186: \varphi_i^a = \rho_i \cdot \theta_i^a
187: $$
188: 
189: where:
190: - **Amplitude (common to all colors):**
191: 
192: $$
193: \rho_i := \|F_i\| \cdot \|p_i\| = \|F_i \otimes p_i\|
194: $$
195: 
196: - **Phase (distinguishes colors):**
197: 
198: $$

200: $$

items.label: prop-cg-su2-geometry
items.title: Geometric Origin of SU(2)
items.content:
300: :label: prop-cg-su2-geometry
301: 
302: The 3-component direction vector $\hat{r} \in S^{2}$ naturally encodes SU(2) structure through the **Hopf fibration**:
303: 
304: $$
305: S^{3} \to S^{2}, \quad \text{with fiber } S^{1} \cong \text{U}(1)
306: $$
307: 
308: Specifically, $S^{2} \cong \text{SU}(2)/\text{U}(1)$, so rotations of $\hat{r}$ on the sphere correspond to SU(2) gauge transformations modulo U(1) phase.

items.label: prop-cg-chirality
items.title: Chirality and Left/Right-Handed Structure
items.content:
358: :label: prop-cg-chirality
359: 
360: Walkers in the Crystalline Gas naturally separate into **left-handed (doublet)** and **right-handed (singlet)** representations of SU(2)_L based on the fitness comparison:
361: 
362: **Left-handed (couples to SU(2)_L):**
363: - Condition: $\Phi(x_{j^*(i)}) > \Phi(x_i)$ (companion has higher fitness)
364: - Equivalently: $S_{\text{ascent}} > 0$
365: - Weak isospin: $T_3 = \frac{1}{2} \cdot \text{sign}(\hat{r}_z)$
366:   - $T_3 = +1/2$ if companion is in $+z$ hemisphere
367:   - $T_3 = -1/2$ if companion is in $-z$ hemisphere
368: 
369: **Right-handed (decouples from SU(2)_L):**
370: - Condition: $\Phi(x_{j^*(i)}) \leq \Phi(x_i)$ (walker is local optimum)
371: - Equivalently: $S_{\text{ascent}} \leq 0$
372: - Weak isospin: $T_3 = 0$

items.label: prop-cg-hypercharge-assignment
items.title: Hypercharge Assignment via Gell-Mann-Nishijima Formula
items.content:
457: :label: prop-cg-hypercharge-assignment
458: 
459: The hypercharge $Y$ of walker $i$ is related to its electric charge $Q$ and weak isospin $T_3$ by:
460: 
461: $$
462: Y = 2(Q - T_3)
463: $$
464: 
465: where:
466: - $Q$ is determined by the fitness value $\Phi(x_i)$ (normalized as "charge")
467: - $T_3 = \pm 1/2$ or $0$ from the SU(2) structure ({prf:ref}`prop-cg-chirality`)
468: 
469: For walkers at equilibrium with $\langle T_3 \rangle = 0$ (velocity isotropy, {prf:ref}`lem-cg-velocity-isotropy`), we have:
470: 
471: $$
472: \langle Y \rangle = 2 \langle Q \rangle = 0
473: $$
